intro: Lachnaea eriocephala, commonly known as the woolly lichen, is a foliose lichen belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly covering of vegetative structures, which gives it a distinctive, fluffy appearance. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found on bark or soil in temperate regions. Its thallus is usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it lacks distinct rhizines. Lachnaea eriocephala plays a role in nutrient cycling and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
